Data: Watson to Trott, no run Watson lands a straight ball that Trott tries to whip to leg but misses
Watson to Trott, no run little bit short and a little bit wide and the cut shot finds point
Watson to Trott, 1 run Trott flicks rather expansively but only for single to fine leg
Watson to Prior, 2 runs wrong line from Watson around leg stump, Prior tries to whip it but gets more edge than middle
Watson to Prior, 1 run again Watson is on the pads, desperate not to give Prior width outside off - Prior works it with his wrists to leg
Watson to Trott, 2 runs good offcutter around off stump and Trott clamps down to run it to third man
Hastings to Prior, 1 run ooh, Prior tries to work to third man but the slower ball means it's a bottom edge that bounces over the stumps and Haddin's head
Hastings to Trott, 1 run Trott gives himself room and mistimes a drive to cover
Hastings to Prior, 1 run with soft hands it's worked to square leg. Just singles available at the moment
Hastings to Trott, no run hint of width allows Trott to flow a drive but straight to cover
Hastings to Trott, no run Hastings is sliding the ball in nicely, not giving Trott any room and the attempted work-to-third-man is inside-edged
Hastings to Trott, no run pushed straight to cover again
Lee to Prior, FOUR runs 'Welcome back,' says Prior, charging down the track and cracking a short of length ball over mid-off for four
Lee to Prior, 1 run a swinging full ball at 146kph is the response from Lee, Prior digs it out towards cover
Lee to Trott, 1 run length ball at 144kph, Trott tucks it towards midwicket and scampers a single
Lee to Prior, no run Lee fires in a yorker on offstump, blocked to the off side
Lee to Prior, no run shorter this time from Lee, defended solidly by Prior
Lee to Prior, 2 runs a high full toss well outside off, clocked at 148kph, slapped towards sweeper cover by Prior for a couple
Hastings to Trott, 1 run short and well outside off, chopped towards deep point by Trott
Hastings to Prior, no run keeps it way outside off, attempted slower ball, full delivery, mistimed by Prior back to the bowler
Hastings to Prior, FOUR runs nothing wrong with the timing on that one, width offered and Prior slashes that over cover for four
Hastings to Prior, 1 run clips this one from offstump towards midwicket for a quick single
Hastings to Trott, 1 run another easy single as the ball is worked towards point
Hastings to Prior, no run Hastings keeps it steady, length ball on off, punched back towards the bowler, Haddin screams 'Down' as soon as the shot is played, Hastings gets down to field that
Lee to Trott, no run Lee nearly hits 150kph, that was 149.9, length ball just outside off, pushed towards down the ground

Lee to Trott, 1 run good god! what a mess that was, terrible cricket all around, both batsmen find themselves at the same end after a huge mix-up, Australia still manage to not get the run-out, Trott blocks the ball from Lee and he's not sure where that went, he turns round to see it round in front of middle stump and
Lee to Prior, SIX runs whoah, what a shot that is, Prior absolutely wallops that slightly short one over midwicket, Lee can't be feeling too happy right now
Lee to Prior, 2 runs full ball played past extra cover
Lee to Prior, 1 run nudged toward square leg for a single
Lee to Trott, 1 run slower ball outside off, worked to third man
Doherty to Trott, no run defended confidently on the front foot
Doherty to Trott, no run defended on the off side once again
Doherty to Trott, 1 run quicker through the air on the pads, Trott works the ball behind square
Doherty to Prior, no run Prior tries to drive but it's a loose shot and the ball takes the outside edge towards short third man
Doherty to Prior, no run quicker ball again, defended on the leg side
Hastings to Trott, no run good length around off stump, played towards the leg side
Hastings to Trott, 5 wide wide ball down leg side, Haddin can't collect that, far too wide
Hastings to Trott, 1 run nudged on the off side off the back foot
Hastings to Prior, 1 run good length but there's width outside off stump, allowing the batsman space to cut towards third man
Hastings to Trott, no run Trott moves forward and across to work the ball off his pads towards midwicket, Watson dives and makes a sharp save
Hastings to Trott, no run slower ball outside off stump at 105 kph, Trott tries to force through cover but mis-times it
Hastings to Trott, 1 run driven through cover this time for the single
Doherty to Trott, 2 runs Trott waits for the flighted delivery around off and drives powerfully through cover. Lee sprints to his right along the boundary and dives full length to save the four
Doherty to Trott, no run Trott sweeps but doesn't make contact. Doherty appeals for leg before. Unsuccessfully.
Doherty to Trott, 1 run Played through square leg for one
Doherty to Prior, no run Prior attempts to sweep from outside off and gets an inside edge on to the pad
Doherty to Prior, no run punched off the back foot towards mid-on but the fielder from midwicket cuts it off
Doherty to Prior, 1 run cut off the back foot through point
Hastings to Prior, no run good length around off stump, Prior moves back and across and pulls towards mid-on
Hastings to Prior, 1 run Prior waits on this one and guides it towards third man
Hastings to Trott, no run good length, angling into off stump, worked off the pads but Watson's sharp at midwicket
Hastings to Trott, 2 runs White has to run a long way to his right on the cover boundary to cut off Trott's fluent drive off the front foot
Hastings to Trott, no run a bit of swing into the right-hander, Trott inside-edges it towards square leg and sets off. He gets sent back
Hastings to Trott, no run can't hit that one. In the blockhole. Defended.
Doherty to Prior, 1 wide Prior misses the sweep but that's because Doherty was down leg side
Doherty to Prior, no run driven fluently but straight to the man at cover
Doherty to Prior, 1 run Prior makes room by moving towards leg, he's trying to go inside out over the infield. Edged towards short third man
Doherty to Trott, 1 run pushed on the off for a single. Trott once again gets between the throw from Clarke and the stumps and cops a blow.
Doherty to Prior, 1 run
Doherty to Trott, 2 runs driven into the deep for two this time
Doherty to Trott, 1 run nudged watchfully off the front foot towards the off side for one
Smith to Trott, 1 run worked off the pads on the front foot through square leg
Smith to Prior, FOUR runs that's a touch too short and Prior is quick to move back and cut the ball hard. He hit that in the air but wide of the fielder at point
Smith to Prior, 1 run again it's a bit short and Prior slaps the ball through cover point off the back foot
Smith to Trott, 2 runs fuller and wider this time. Trott reaches out and drives to deep cover
Smith to Trott, no run tossed up into the blockhole, Trott plays it back to the bowler
Smith to Trott, 1 run driven to long-on for a single
Doherty to Trott, 1 run Doherty angles the ball into Trott who drives fluently to long off
Doherty to Prior, 1 run the length is short outside off, Prior cuts in front of point for one
Doherty to Trott, no run Trott strides forward and defends back towards the bowler
Doherty to Trott, 1 run Trott gets to 50 off 65 balls by driving a wide ball through cover point
Doherty to Prior, no run driven hard, but to the fielder at cover
Doherty to Prior, 1 run quicker and straighter ball, Prior cuts from off stump through the off side

Smith to Prior, OUT caught! Prior's cut one straight to point. The length was good and the line was outside off. Prior went back into his crease to cut, and found Doherty. That spun and bounced a touch and it hit the top edge
Smith to Pietersen, no run Pietersen defends the first ball towards the bowler
Smith to Pietersen, 1 run played towards midwicket for one
Smith to Trott, no run defended once again on the leg side
Smith to Trott, 1 run Trott turns the strike over once again with a deft single towards the leg side
Smith to Pietersen, 1 run Pietersen takes a step out and punches the ball towards long off
Doherty to Pietersen, 2 runs and Pietersen attempts to drive past the fielder at mid-on. Bollinger does well to dive to his left and take the pace off the ball
Doherty to Pietersen, FOUR runs and here he goes! Lofting the ball into the vacant space at the long-on boundary. Pietersen came down and hit it cleanly
Doherty to Pietersen, no run defended on the front foot towards the off
Doherty to Pietersen, 1 run played off the back foot towards point
Doherty to Trott, no run Trott takes a stride forward and blocks
Doherty to Trott, 1 run nudged off the front foot towards midwicket for one
Smith to Trott, no run defended on the back foot towards the off
Smith to Trott, no run Trott inside edges a drive on to his pad and the ball goes on the off
Smith to Trott, no run a quick full toss and Trott hits it back to the bowler on the bounce
Smith to Trott, 1 run a slower, flighted delivery. Trott drives through cover for one
Smith to Pietersen, 1 run Pietersen got into position for the sweep early and paddled it to fine leg
Smith to Trott, 2 runs Trott jumps out, gets to the pitch of the ball and drives straight past the bowler
Doherty to Pietersen, no run Pietersen takes two steps down and then defends
Doherty to Pietersen, 1 run he stays back this time and steers the ball through point
Doherty to Trott, 1 run Trott goes back and across and flicks a straight one through square leg
Doherty to Pietersen, 1 run Pietersen gets down on one knee for the paddle sweep very early once again, and collects one
Doherty to Trott, no run defended towards midwicket on the back foot
Doherty to Trott, 2 runs Trott makes room to drive and forces Lee to sprint along the boundary rope to save four at deep cover
Smith to Pietersen, 1 leg bye Pietersen comes down the pitch and gets hit on the pad. Smith appeals but he was a long way forward and perhaps outside the line.
Smith to Trott, 1 run played towards cover point for a single

Smith to Pietersen, OUT caught at long-on! The fielder was back on the boundary this time, but Pietersen went after Smith anyway. He came forward, got under the ball and hoisted it towards the boundary. Not enough distance on it though and Marsh ran in a few paces to take a simple catch
Smith to Bell, no run Bell steps out right away and punches to mid-off

Smith to Bell, OUT and he's been caught as well! Bell took two steps out of his crease to play the ball, Smith beat him in the flight and the ball pitched short of the batsman, Bell tried to readjust to dab the ball towards the off side but got a thick edge through to Haddin. Haddin almost wanted to complete the stump
Smith to Morgan, no run Morgan plays his first ball back to the bowler
Doherty to Trott, no run quicker ball and dead straight. Defended on the back foot on the leg side
Doherty to Trott, no run Trott misses the sweep and the ball hits the pad. Doherty appeals for lbw and is turned down. Clarke has a word about the review but decides against it.
Doherty to Trott, no run defended on the off side from the crease
Doherty to Trott, no run played back to the bowler
Doherty to Trott, no run cut off the back foot towards point
Doherty to Trott, 1 run punched off the back foot towards cover for a quick single. Just one run off that over.
Smith to Trott, 1 run nudged behind point for another quick single
Smith to Morgan, 1 run a bit too short, allowing Morgan to go back and slap the ball towards mid-off
Smith to Trott, 1 run driven off the back foot past midwicket for a single
Smith to Morgan, 1 run Morgan moves forward and across to nudge the ball off the pads towards square leg
Smith to Trott, 2 runs full toss and Trott sweeps towards deep square leg
Smith to Trott, no run the faster one from Smith and Trott defends from his crease towards the bowler
Doherty to Morgan, no run Morgan tries to reverse sweep and there's a slip in place. The ball goes to the fielder on the bounce.

Doherty to Morgan, 1 run Morgan tries to defend on the front foot and gets hit on the pad. Haddin collects the ball and underarms it towards the non-striker's end and concedes an overthrow. Doherty wasn't anticipating the ball coming towards him.
Doherty to Trott, no run defended on the front foot
Doherty to Trott, 1 run played through the off side for a single
Doherty to Morgan, no run Morgan works the ball from middle and leg towards the on side
Doherty to Morgan, 2 runs Morgan plays a pre-meditated paddle sweep and collects two
Lee to Trott, no run good length outside off, Trott strides forward and drives towards cover
Lee to Trott, 2 runs Lee gets that one to swing back into Trott. The length was full and Trott worked the ball through midwicket
Lee to Trott, 1 run too wide from Lee and Trott reaches out to tap it to the fielder on the point boundary
Lee to Morgan, 2 runs Morgan drives a full ball through point and gives the fielder at third man some running to do
Lee to Morgan, no run pushed off the front foot towards the off side
Lee to Morgan, no run Lee slants the ball into the left-hander from round the wicket. Morgan works the ball past midwicket but the fielder at mid-on runs to his left and cuts it off
Doherty to Trott, 1 run Trott comes forward and pushes the ball off his pads through the leg side
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run Morgan also guides the ball through square leg
Doherty to Trott, no run Doherty fires the ball into the pads, Trott can't make contact with the sweep
Doherty to Trott, 1 run driven to long off for a single
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run width offered outside off and Morgan cuts through point off the back foot
Doherty to Trott, 1 run Trott steps out and closes the face to play the ball towards midwicket
Smith to Trott, no run played towards cover on the front foot
Smith to Trott, 1 run a flatter shorter delivery and Trott cuts towards the fielder on the point boundary
Smith to Morgan, 1 run nudged off the front foot towards the off for a quick single
Smith to Trott, FOUR runs he's hit that superbly. The length was full, Trott got down on one knee and slog-swept the ball firmly towards the deep midwicket boundary. First four for him in 24 overs.
Smith to Trott, 1 run now he gives Morgan the strike with a single
Smith to Morgan, 1 run Morgan reaches out for a wide one and drives through the off side
Doherty to Morgan, no run played back to the bowler
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run too full to cut and Morgan mis-times the shot through point
Doherty to Trott, no run defended on the front foot towards the off side
Doherty to Trott, 2 runs Doherty bowls quicker and faster, Trott was down the pitch and adjusted his shot and played the ball towards deep square
Doherty to Trott, 1 run worked off the pads through midwicket
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run cut off the back foot towards deep point. That's the end of Doherty's spell. He's done a good job considering he began bowling when Prior was batting aggressively.
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run starts outside off stump on a length and Morgan steers a pat to cover
Bollinger to Trott, 1 run back of a length again from Bollinger, Trott shuffles outside off to work to midwicket
Bollinger to Morgan, no run Bollinger finds an ideal off-stump line and Morgan gets everything behind his block
Bollinger to Morgan, no run Morgan hasn't looked at his best this series but his back-foot drive here really pings to cover
Bollinger to Morgan, no run cracker from Bollinger! Back of a length and the harder new ball zips away and climbs past the outside edge
Bollinger to Morgan, no run touch slower this time and the line remains impeccable, hugging off stump. Morgan defends to end a fine Bollinger over
Hastings to Trott, FOUR runs Trott is down the wicket to greet Hastings and slapping a drive past mid-off, all along the ground to the boundary
Hastings to Trott, 1 run that keeps Trott in his crease and from there he works an ugly drive to long-off
Hastings to Morgan, no run Hastings slips this down the leg side but it flicks the pads on its way through to Haddin
Hastings to Morgan, 1 run Hastings again explores the pads and Morgan flicks a single to square leg to bring the 200 up
Hastings to Trott, no run full and outside off stump, Trott drags it back to the bowler
Hastings to Trott, 2 runs poor line this time, sliding down leg and Trott clips it around the corner
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run Morgan skips down the wicket at Bollinger, who bangs it in short in response, Morgan then guides an uppish cut to third man
Bollinger to Trott, 1 run Bollinger's good line means Trott can only open the face to third man
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run ooh, Bollinger bangs in a short ball that Morgan tries to pull. Didn't get anything of it and it spooned just over midwicket
Bollinger to Trott, 1 run Trott dabs another single to third man, giving himself a bit of room to play the shot
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run Hussey fields very smartly at midwicket, saving Morgan's well-timed flick and the batsmen scamper through
Bollinger to Trott, 1 run after giving himself room outside leg this time Trott reverts to his more customary move, outside off, and working to midwicket to bring up the 50 stand
Hastings to Trott, 2 runs Trott gives himself room outside leg again to carve Hastings out to deep point

Hastings to Trott, FOUR runs ah, lovely shot. Don't bowl on Trott's pads. It's a lesson Australians have refused to learn all tour. Flicked around the corner with perfect timing to bring up a boundary away from a hundred
Hastings to Trott, no run much better line from Hastings outside off and it's jabbed to third man
Hastings to Trott, 2 runs short ball and whipped, half-pull, out to deep midwicket. Just a single away...

Hastings to Trott, 1 run there is Trott's hundred and fittingly gets there by working a full ball to deep midwicket. After searching for it, he eventually kisses the England badge on his helmet. Excellent innings really, absolutely no fuss at all
Hastings to Morgan, FOUR runs poor ball, very short and down the leg side. Morgan gives this absolutely everything in his pull shot and it sails high to the fine leg rope
Bollinger to Trott, 1 run fullish ball is pushed to cover for a scampered single
Bollinger to Morgan, 1 run Morgan crouches low in his stance and stays low as he chops this to deep point
Bollinger to Trott, no run full and wide of off stump, Trott looked to chase the drive but couldn't quite reach it
Bollinger to Trott, no run good line and length from Bollinger and solidly blocked to point
Bollinger to Trott, no run oops, full toss that seems to surprise Trott. It was quite a high full toss and Trott couldn't take advantage, mistiming to mid-off
Bollinger to Trott, 1 run better timing on this drive but mid-off is back allowing a single. Time for the Powerplay methinks
Hussey to Trott, no run starts well enough outside off and is poked to third man
Hussey to Trott, no run fuller ball is driven firmly back at him
Hussey to Trott, no run Trott is not a fashionable bloke but tries to prove just how cool he is by reverse sweeping here. Doesn't get much of it

Hussey to Trott, OUT Hussey gets the breakthrough! Plenty of turn here for him, comes in a long way and cramped Trott as he tried to cut, took the bottom edge and cannoned onto middle stump. Excellent breakthrough to end a fine innings
Hussey to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood is the new man and does something he failed to last game - finds the middle of the bat - but only to steer to point
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run end of an excellent over, Collingwood leans forward and prods to mid-off
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run starts well enough on a length around middle and poked away in defence
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run this time Collingwood is solidly forward in defence
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run driven this time but straight to cover. Good start from Smith
Smith to PD Collingwood, 1 run finally Collingwood gets off the strike, working a single into space
Smith to Morgan, 1 run Morgan flicks finely around the corner to pick off a single
Smith to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood's back-foot bunt goes straight to mid-off

Hussey to Morgan, OUT Hussey gets his second! Morgan's reverse-sweep was timed well but straight to point, who jumped high to take the chance above his head. Wickets falling at ideal time and England are in danger of having the tail in for the Powerplay
Hussey to Yardy, 1 run Yardy plonks his first ball through mid-off for a single
Hussey to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood's attempted drive slides off the thickish edge to point
Hussey to PD Collingwood, no run worked to mid-on, Collingwood keeps finding the infield
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run this time Collingwood does find the single, pushing down the ground
Hussey to Yardy, no run Yardy gets a straight ball that is defended very, very carefully
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run starts well on off stump and Collingwood dabs a single to third man
Lee to Yardy, 1 run very full from Lee, good line too and Yardy can only squeeze a single to third man
Lee to PD Collingwood, no run full and swinging in, fine delivery, Collingwood can only just about dig it out
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run Collingwood down the wicket, bounding down, and drives solidly but straight to deep cover
Lee to Yardy, 2 runs some late inswing takes this towards Yard's pads and he flicks towards fine leg where Cameron white scoots around and slides to field
Lee to Yardy, 1 run full again, excellent over really, and Yardy can only bunt to cover
Bollinger to Yardy, no run good start from Bollinger, haring in and landing it on a length, worked to midwicket
Bollinger to Yardy, FOUR runs too short from Bollinger, width too, Yardy upper-cuts with enough top edge to beat the sliding fielder at third man
Bollinger to Yardy, 1 leg bye fuller this time, much better, and it thuds off the pads
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, 2 runs Collingwood bounds down the wicket again and heaves across the line, no great timing but the intent is right and he gets a couple to deep midwicket
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, 1 run Collingwood is again down the wicket but Bollinger adjusts well and prods a single to cover
Bollinger to Yardy, no run Yardy gets down very early to try and dab a poke sweep, crashes into the ribs and Bollinger, oddly, appeals
Lee to PD Collingwood, SIX runs heave ho! There we go! Collingwood has finally middled one and he's absolutely mullered it. Down the wicket and slugged into the stands over midwicket
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run this time it's wide outside off and Collingwood works to third man
Lee to Yardy, 2 runs slower bouncer and Yardy has to wait and wait to slog this to midwicket
Lee to Yardy, no run Yardy gives himself room outside leg and tries to carve it away, goes too far though and can't reach it
Lee to Yardy, FOUR runs ugly, but it does the trick. Yardy again giving himself plenty of room and the carve is toe-ended past the keeper to the third man rope
Lee to Yardy, 1 run full toss on the pads and Yardy wheels it towards deep square
Bollinger to Yardy, FOUR runs this Yardy innings is beginning to flow. Bollinger lands just short of a good length and Yardy is deep into his crease to shove it to the midwicket rope, timed it well
Bollinger to Yardy, no run cut firmly but straight to point. Collingwood wants one but is rightly sent back
Bollinger to Yardy, FOUR runs Yardy stepped back and Bollinger responded but going full, but overcooked it and a full toss was slapped straight of deep midwicket for four
Bollinger to Yardy, 1 run this time it's worked with a bit of edge into the off side
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs ah, Collingwood middles another! Plays this really well. Down the wicket and eased, rather than slugged, to the long-on boundary
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, 1 wide Bollinger is struggling this over, and shoves this a long, long way outside off stump
Bollinger to PD Collingwood, no run good ball to finish a poor over. Collingwood down the wicket and Bollinger dug in a slower bouncer that the batsman couldn't work into the leg side
Watson to Yardy, no run Yardy down the wicket and throwing his arms at the ball, doesn't time it at all and it trickles to cover. England though about a single but there was none there
Watson to Yardy, 1 run good full length here, slower too, and difficult to get away. Driven without much timing to long-off
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood again advances before trying to sweep/ramp it over short midwicket, the slower ball meant he was through it long before it arrived

Watson to PD Collingwood, 1 leg bye charging down the track again and Collingwood tried to heave to leg. Missed and it struck him on the pads. Clarke calls for a review because it hit on the back leg, but outside off stump so never going to be at
Watson to Yardy, 1 leg bye another appeal from Watson as a fullish ball gets Yardy on the pads as he tried to flick around the corner
Watson to PD Collingwood, 1 run another slower ball the Collingwood slaps without much timing to deep mid-on
Hussey to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs Collingwood lines up a sweep, smashes it hard straight to deep midwicket on the bounce. White makes an utter hash of the save and it goes through him to the rope
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run attempted reverse-poke comes off a flurry of bat and glove and trickles for one
Hussey to Yardy, 1 run Yardy gives himself room to smack to cover for a swift single
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 2 runs Collingwood shelves the reverse sweep and pushes to long-off, comes back for the second and would have been gone if it hit but it didn't
Hussey to PD Collingwood, no run fired in full and straight and bunted back to the bowler

Hussey to PD Collingwood, OUT Collingwood tries to repeat the sweep/heave that got the boundary earlier, this time he timed it too well and it went straight to White who made no mistake this time. Ends an ugly innings but at least it showed signs of form
Watson to Shahzad, 2 runs short ball from Watson, Shahzad gives himself room to wristily flick to past point
Watson to Shahzad, no run this time Shahzad walks across his stumps but Watson follows and it's driven to cover
Watson to Shahzad, 1 run another wristy drive but it slides off the edge past Haddin
Watson to Yardy, 1 run Yardy down on one knee trying to poke a sweep fine but gets too much of it and it goes to fine leg
Watson to Shahzad, 1 run flicked airily, but straight to mid-on
Watson to Yardy, 1 run Yardy's lack of timing saves him here as the drive goes one-bounce to deepish mid-off

Hussey to Yardy, FOUR runs excellent shot from Yardy, really top stuff. Down the wicket and giving himself room to drive into a gap wide of long-off for four. This is turning into an unlikely gem of an innings
Hussey to Yardy, 1 run this is horridly timed down the ground, trickling to long-on
Hussey to Shahzad, OUT Hussey gets another! What figures he has. Shahzad mistimes a full toss and it loops to midwicket who takes a very gentle chance
Hussey to Yardy, FOUR runs Yardy is down the wicket, giving himself some room and drives excellently down the ground and times it well enough to run for four
Hussey to Yardy, 1 run this is shoved in very short and Yardy should have got more, in the end he belted a pull shot to deep midwicket. Leaves Tremlett to try and bring up the 300
Hussey to Tremlett, no run good finish to an excellent spell from Hussey, shoved in quick and full and past Tremlett's attempted drive

So Australia will need 300 to win the match and seal the series. England started and finished well but again a mid-innings stumble cost them. It's a very good wicket and the outfield is swift so Australia should back themselves to do it. England, remember, only have three frontline bowlers. Peter English will have a bulletin
Watson and Haddin to open. James Anderson is back in England's team and is opening the attack. One slip in place.

About five minutes to go before the Australian openers come out and try to seal the series at the Adelaide Oval. If Australia get to 300, the last three games of this series will be dead rubbers. 300 is a long way away though.
Anderson to Watson, 1 run Steered towards third man for a single
Anderson to Haddin, no run good length around off stump, Haddin stays in his crease and defends
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run Haddin gets squared up a touch as he attempts to defend from the crease, that ball swung away a touch from the right-hander. Single towards cover
Anderson to Watson, no run defended on the back foot towards the bowler
Anderson to Watson, 1 run Anderson angles into Watson's body and he nudges towards the leg side for a quick one
Anderson to Haddin, no run Haddin tries to make room by moving towards leg but Anderson follows him and cramps him up. Haddin ends up defending on the off side
Shahzad to Watson, no run Shahzad hits a good length and slants the ball into Watson who gets behind the line and blocks
Shahzad to Watson, no run Watson strides forward and drives towards extra cover
Shahzad to Watson, no run good length just outside off, pushed off the front foot towards the off side
Shahzad to Watson, no run Watson strides forward and punches a good length ball towards mid-off
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run good length but the line is just outside off, Watson chops it towards third man
Shahzad to Haddin, 3 runs Haddin gets a thick inside edge as he tries to drive and the ball races away through midwicket, Morgan pursues and pulls it in just inside the boundary
Anderson to Haddin, 1 leg bye slants down leg side and Watson misses the glance
Anderson to Watson, no run defended on the front foot

Anderson to Watson, FOUR runs top effort from Morgan! Watson clipped a full ball off his pads in the air and it travelled fast towards deep midwicket. Morgan came in running from the boundary to take the flat catch but the ball fell short of him and bounced past
Anderson to Watson, no run defended on the back foot
Anderson to Watson, 1 run dabbed towards the off side, Haddin wanted a risky single and he would have been history had Collingwood hit the stumps from point
Anderson to Haddin, no run pushed towards the off side
Shahzad to Watson, no run good length outside off stump, Watson cuts but mis-times the shot towards point, 140.3kph that was
Shahzad to Watson, no run cut, and it is timed well, but the placement is straight to the fielder
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run worked off the hips through midwicket for a single
Shahzad to Haddin, no run Haddin makes room again by moving towards leg. He tries to flay the ball over the off side but he had moved so far away that he couldn't reach it
Shahzad to Haddin, no run pushed off the back foot towards point
Shahzad to Haddin, FOUR runs makes room and smash! Haddin goes inside out and lofts the ball over mid-off for four. Clean, crisp contact to a length delivery
Anderson to Watson, 1 run driven firmly off the front foot towards extra cover. The fielder there can't stop it cleanly so there's a single available
Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs and Haddin does it again. Length delivery outside off stump. Haddin moves outside leg and lifts the ball over mid-off for another inside-out four
Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, Haddin makes a bit of room - not as much as previous times - but absolutely blazes it through point with a fierce cut shot
Anderson to Haddin, 1 leg bye Anderson darts one into the pads and the ball hits the pad as Haddin gets squared up in his crease. Watson calls him for a single after the ball goes towards third man
Anderson to Watson, no run defended solidly off the front foot
Anderson to Watson, no run defended on the front foot once again

Tremlett to Haddin, FOUR runs good length ball and this time Haddin moves a touch towards the off and swings the ball wide of the fielder at short fine leg. He didn't middle that - more of an inside edge - but he will take it
Tremlett to Haddin, no run defended on the back foot towards the off
Tremlett to Haddin, no run Haddin winds up and has a hard swing at a good length delivery. He gets a thick inside edge on to his thigh
Tremlett to Marsh, 1 run full ball on leg stump, Marsh leans across and nudges it towards the on-side for one
Tremlett to Watson, no run Watson stays solid in defence and plays from the crease
Anderson to Marsh, no run hits Marsh on the pad with one that slants into the left-hander. The impact was on top of the pad so maybe a bit too high.
Anderson to Marsh, no run Marsh moves forward and plays the ball with the angle into him towards the leg side
Anderson to Marsh, no run no room for Marsh to work with whatsoever with this angle into him, he pushes on the off side
Anderson to Marsh, no run

Anderson to Marsh, OUT caught and bowled! Anderson was testing Marsh with this angle into the left-hander from round the wicket. He was attacking the stumps constantly and not giving the batsman room. Marsh pushed a bit more at this one, the ball hit the bat a little low and went straight back to the bowler. Caught and
Anderson to Clarke, no run Clarke defends his first ball on the back foot
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run Watson hasn't had much of the strike of late and he rotates it with a drive off the front foot towards cover
Tremlett to Clarke, no run left alone outside off stump
Tremlett to Clarke, no run good length outside off stump, Clarke strides forward and lets it go again
Tremlett to Clarke, no run and another one goes past under the watchful eyes of Michael Clarke, don't see too many batsmen leaving three out of four deliveries these days
Tremlett to Clarke, no run this time the line is closer to the body and Clarke defends
Tremlett to Clarke, no run driven off the front foot towards mid-off
Anderson to Watson, no run tight line and length from Anderson on off and middle. Watson gets behind it and defends from his crease
Anderson to Watson, 1 run too full and too straight this time and Watson clips the ball off his pads through midwicket
Anderson to Clarke, no run good length on off stump, Clarke strides forward and plays the ball towards point
Anderson to Clarke, 3 runs the length is a touch shorter and Clarke was forward as the ball rose on him. He got on top of the bounce by jumping before punching the ball through cover
Anderson to Watson, no run defended on the off side
Anderson to Watson, 1 run the length is on the shorter side and Watson plays that flowing muscular pull shot of his, there's a man on the boundary at deep midwicket though
Tremlett to Watson, no run played with an open face off the back foot towards point
Tremlett to Watson, 2 runs Tremlett strays on to the pads and Watson gives it a real whip with his wrists to send the ball racing towards deep backward square
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run he doesn't time the straight drive well though, but he's placed it straight enough to get one before mid-off and mid-on converge on the ball
Tremlett to Clarke, no run Clarke moves forward and plays a punchy drive, but hits the ball on the bounce to the fielder at short cover
Tremlett to Clarke, 1 run Clarke moves across his stumps and dabs the ball close on the leg side for a single
Tremlett to Watson, 2 runs there's width outside the off stump on offer and Watson cuts the ball firmly to third man
Shahzad to Clarke, no run full ball on off stump, Clarke drives off the front foot towards mid-off
Shahzad to Clarke, no run Clarke drives off the front foot towards cover point, can't find the gap though
Shahzad to Clarke, 1 run too straight from Shahzad and Clarke flicks through midwicket
Shahzad to Watson, FOUR runs length delivery outside off stump. It may have been a bit slower too. Watson plants his foot forward, winds up, and biffs the ball over the fielder at mid-on for four
Shahzad to Watson, FOUR runs over mid-off this time. Both the fielders at mid-on and mid-off are in the circle and Watson backed himself to hit cleanly over them.
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run both those fielders are back on the boundary now so Watson drives straight but along the ground
Tremlett to Watson, no run defended confidently on the front foot towards the off side

Tremlett to Watson, SIX runs massive hit! Watson has such power and yet he looks so smooth and efficient when he makes clean contact. Length delivery outside off and Watson swings across the line to send the ball into the stands at the long-on boundary
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run full toss and Watson punches it down the ground for one
Tremlett to Clarke, no run good length outside off. Clarke lets it go.
Tremlett to Clarke, no run full and straight, Clarke flicks off the pads to midwicket
Tremlett to Clarke, FOUR runs Tremlett strays on to the pads and Clarke moves across and glances the ball off his hips towards the fine-leg boundary. Nothing fancy, text-book leg glance.
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run good length on off stump, Watson defends towards point. Clarke comes quite a long way down from the non-striker's end before he has to hurry back
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run Watson aimed for the swing across the line but Collingwood is slower and he was through the shot too early and missed
PD Collingwood to Watson, 1 run pushed down the ground with a straight bat towards long on
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run too straight and Clarke uses the angle to move across and flick through midwicket
PD Collingwood to Watson, FOUR runs too wide outside off and Watson uses the freedom to glide the ball between short third man and point with a well-timed cut
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run was he aiming for the mow there? Watson brought his bat down in a hurry and opened the face to dab the ball towards point in the end
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run worked through square leg for one
Yardy to Watson, 2 runs Watson goes back and nudges the ball gently towards midwicket. the fielder needs to come off the boundary so they sprint two
Yardy to Watson, 1 run Clarke nudges the ball towards square leg for another quick single
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run
Yardy to Watson, 1 run Watson tried to force that through the off side but mis-timed it towards mid-off
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run pushed towards mid-on for a single
Shahzad to Clarke, 1 run width outside off stump, met with a flat-batted cut out to deep point
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run less width this time, and dabbed into the covers with a defensive bat
Shahzad to Clarke, no run drawn forward, and blocked to mid-off
Shahzad to Clarke, no run chopped hard out to backward point
Shahzad to Clarke, 1 run a hint of outswing, but starting too wide. Driven into the gap at cover
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run open-faced steer, down to third man
Yardy to Watson, no run brought forward, half an appeal
Yardy to Watson, no run blocked once again
Yardy to Watson, no run good loopy delivery, drops onto a good length, and defended
Yardy to Watson, 2 runs round the wicket, a bit of angle onto leg stump, and worked round the corner
Yardy to Watson, 1 run picks the gap again, but Yardy's in a good rhythm
Yardy to Clarke, no run drawn down the track but a touch beaten in flight. Decent over
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run forward to a good-length nibbler, and defended
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run looped onto a middle-and-off-stump line. Pushed firmly back to the bowler
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run back a touch in length, defended again
PD Collingwood to Watson, 1 run good line and length from Collingwood, the ball nips off the seam a touch and deflects to square leg
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run driven from deep in the crease, picked up at midwicket
Yardy to Watson, 1 run cut firmly in front of square, and there is Watto's fifty. Great effort once again
Yardy to White, no run tossed onto a good length from around the wicket, and blocked
Yardy to White, 2 runs a monstrous mow into no-man's land at deep cover. A bit lucky, but gets away with it
Yardy to White, no run looped onto leg stump, and pushed to mid-on
Yardy to White, 1 run dragged down, a bit of a rank delivery to be frank, but met with a calm nudge off the pads
Yardy to Watson, 1 run slow, slow, slow delivery, a fraction short, but not enough pace to work with. A miscued pull dribbles out to mid-on
PD Collingwood to Watson, 1 run good areas from Colly, shaping into the batsman and pushed down the ground
PD Collingwood to White, no run defended from the crease, and this one is jabbed back down the pitch, in a bit of a hurry
PD Collingwood to White, 1 run another single down the ground, excellent rhythm from Collingwood
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run more subtle movement through to the air, and defended again
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run pushed out to mid-on, and well fielded with a stretch. On the spot again
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run massive appeal as this one jags off the seam, but there looked as though there was bat involved there, and it might have been down leg. Otherwise, pretty close
Yardy to White, 1 run prodded into the covers
Yardy to Watson, 1 run poor ball, but the leg-side sweeper is in place to tidy up a long-hop
Yardy to White, no run poked into the covers, and easily fielded
Yardy to White, 2 runs fuller delivery, and this one is lofted into space over mid-on. Plugs as it lands, and they jog back for two
Yardy to White, no run fuller, and straighter. Defended

Yardy to White, 2 byes really wide on the crease, ends up as a low full-toss, and Prior can't do much as the ball is nutmegged between his legs. Looked as though there was bat involved, but the umpire thinks not
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run driven up to cover
PD Collingwood to Watson, 1 run driven through mid-on
PD Collingwood to White, no run good delivery, a fraction shorter but arrow-straight. White prods down at the last minute
PD Collingwood to White, no run more appreciable nibble off the seam, and blocked once again
PD Collingwood to White, no run blatted into the covers, where Strauss fields with a juggle
PD Collingwood to White, no run defended with a shuffle on off stump. Excellent probing work from Collingwood. He's bowling like Ronnie Irani in 2002. And that's actually a compliment
Shahzad to Watson, no run a swishing drive, back down the track but intercepted in Shahzad's followthrough
Shahzad to Watson, 2 runs too much width, and clobbered out to deep point. A sniff of reverse swing though ...
Shahzad to Watson, no run more slight movement, open-faced guide to point
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run defended off the back foot, a quick call, and through they hustle
Shahzad to White, no run wide on the crease, angling in and defended with a big stride
Shahzad to White, no run genuine swing that time, very full and a bit too wide, but White's wild swing finds nothing but thin air
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run great shape from Collingwood, swinging late and defended on middle-and-leg
PD Collingwood to Watson, 1 run this one stays straight, and is calmly driven to mid-off
PD Collingwood to White, no run driven hard, but straight into the turf, Collingwood leaps in his followthrough and intercepts
PD Collingwood to White, 1 run speared into the toes, swinging all the way, and shovelled into the leg-side
PD Collingwood to Watson, 1 run on the pads, clipped firmly
PD Collingwood to White, 1 wide swinging late, and way down leg
PD Collingwood to White, 1 run outside off, pushed into the covers. Another tidy over
Shahzad to White, no run swished across the line from outside off, but can't get enough pace on the shot as mid-on fields
Shahzad to White, 1 run clear swing, angling from outside off towards middle. Met with a mow, and picked up at midwicket. That came right off the toe
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run outswinger this time, good variation. Nudged down to third man
Shahzad to White, 1 run banged in short, decent delivery, pulled to the midwicket sweeper
Shahzad to Watson, FOUR runs driven, in the air, but that beats the diving mid-off, and it's a very welcome boundary. They've been few and far between in recent overs
PD Collingwood to White, no run blocked into the covers
PD Collingwood to White, no run good nip off the seam again, deflected square with one hand coming off the bat
PD Collingwood to White, 1 run jags off the pitch again, another single to midwicket
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run defended once again, this really is a fine spell
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run a fraction shorter but swished straight to midwicket
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run dabbed down to third man, another single. And that's the halfway mark of the innings
Shahzad to Hussey, 1 run this is slashed wide of point down to the boundary rider who scoots round to save

Shahzad to White, no run Shahzad finds a straighter line is rewarded with a rare straight bat from White, who has played possibly the ugliest 27 balls I've ever seen. And I've watched plenty of Collingwood
Shahzad to White, 2 runs urgh, this is once again filthy looking from White, but effective enough as it's slugged wide of long-off
Shahzad to White, no run back on careful defence here
Shahzad to White, no run Shahzad dares fuller, looking for swing and it's carefully blocked out. Shahzad spins on his heels and swaggers back to his mark
Shahzad to White, no run big wind up from Shahzad as he was about to deliver, but it was all a deception because it's in fact slower, much slower and blocked away
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run Collingwood wobbles this onto a straight line and length and Hussey has no pace to work this into space
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run touch fuller and a leg-stump line means Hussey can tuck it away to the leg side
PD Collingwood to White, 2 runs White backs away looking for room, Colly in the manner of Courtney Walsh, sort of, follows him so White has to fiddle it around the corner
PD Collingwood to White, 1 run this time White does succeed in giving himself room and carves out to deep cover
PD Collingwood to Hussey, no run a firm drive is played so perfectly straight that it went into the stumps at the non-striker's end
PD Collingwood to Hussey, 1 run a Collingwood slower ball is very slow and Hussey has to do all the work to get drive, earning a single to a deepish mid-off

Tremlett to Hussey, FOUR runs starts with a pretty meek half-tracker that is pulled smartly, in front of midwicket where... OH NO! Silly KP slid to field with one hand, flicked it up but onto his own body and it bounced off over the rope. Oops
Tremlett to Hussey, 1 run after all that fun this is worked away into space for one
Tremlett to White, 1 run the batsmen trade singles as White pushes this into the off side
Tremlett to Hussey, no run this is on a length around off stump but Hussey's steer picks out the infielder at point
Tremlett to Hussey, no run fuller from Tremlett, which always seems hazardous, but the firm drive finds a tumbling Bell
Tremlett to Hussey, no run this is full again and driven with a hint of inside edge towards mid-off
Trott to White, 1 run starts slow around middle and is fiddled to leg
Trott to Hussey, 1 leg bye Trott has found a decent enough line sliding into the batsman and thuds off the thigh towards square leg
Trott to White, no run the lack of pace means the midwicket-clip is not firm enough

Trott to White, 3 runs White has seen enough and goes for a booming drive down the ground, not perfectly timed and Luke Wright slid brilliantly to pull off a remarkable save on the long-off boundary. He really is a special(ist) fielder
Trott to Hussey, no run driven hard again but straight to cover
Trott to Hussey, 2 runs ooh, Trott almost has a breakthrough. Backs away to give himself room and aims a carve over cover that gets a top edge which loops over the infield and plops down safely
Tremlett to White, no run cracker from Tremlett. Beats White in all sorts of ways. Bounced, was a touch quicker and jagged away off the seam past a hanging defensive prod
Tremlett to White, no run beaten again! This was a less special delivery, touch wide and White aimed a late cut and it skimmed past the edge
Tremlett to White, 1 run shortish ball is crashed to short extra cover where Bell fields superbly
Tremlett to Hussey, 2 runs close again, on and around off stump and the attempted smash to leg comes off an inside edge
Tremlett to Hussey, no run firmly driven from the crease but to mid-off
Tremlett to Hussey, 1 run Tremlett ends a good over by landing this back of a length on off stump and it skews off an inside edge again
Trott to Hussey, 2 runs Trott lands this on a length around middle and again the inside edge is productive, earning a couple to square leg
Trott to Hussey, 1 run fiddled into the leg side for a jogged single
Trott to White, no run White tries to give himself room but Trott follows him and the slap to off isn't timed at all
Trott to White, 1 run full ball meets a very full face that sends the ball to long-on
Trott to Hussey, 1 run driven again safely, but Australia need some boundaries
Trott to White, 2 runs this is hit hard down to KP on the cover boundary who makes no mistake cutting the ball off
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run starts a touch short and is pulled hard but straight to deep midwicket
Yardy to White, 3 runs White gets down low to dip this over his head, he then gets his head down and motors three
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run touch shorter and Hussey gets deep into his crease to push to long-off
Yardy to White, 1 bye aah, missed stumping, White charged down and Yardy fired it in much quicker and wide, beat White, and Prior spilled a certain stumping chance
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run this is driven firmly back down the wicket

Yardy to White, no run waa? Moon-ball! Like Jeremy Snape. It was so, so slow and full - a full toss in fact. It should have ended up out of Adelaide but White didn't pick it up and patted it back to the bowler
Trott to Hussey, 2 runs Trott is doing a fine all-round job, landing this on a length with no pace at all and it's driven to long-on
Trott to Hussey, no run dribbles off the thigh and bat onto Prior's gloves and cannons away for a couple. Drop chance, if you're being mean
Trott to Hussey, 1 run driven very firmly but to mid-on
Trott to White, no run this is carefully prodded away
Trott to White, no run oh dear, White runs outside off stump to try and scoop/paddle this away and misses it completely
Trott to White, no run this time he reverts to convention but timing has deserted him this innings
Yardy to Hussey, 1 run another milked single down the ground
Yardy to White, FOUR runs finally White times one! Down the wicket and lifting this into a gap wide of deep cover, it sped to the rope
Yardy to White, 1 run driven firmly back towards the bowler who dives to get a hand on it. Brings up a 50 stand, it took a while
Yardy to Hussey, 1 wide oops, shoved down the leg side and Yardy has to apologise
Yardy to Hussey, 1 leg bye Hussey does as he's gone all innings and works a single
Yardy to White, no run Yardy sees White coming down the track and fires it in quicker, preventing any runs
Yardy to White, FOUR runs ah, lovely shot, White waited on this and thumped to cover, the man on the boundary thought he had a chance but he couldn't catch up with it
Trott to Hussey, 2 runs Hussey this time is on the charge and slaps this out to deep cover. Well timed enough to take a couple
Trott to Hussey, no run no getting this away as it's worked to short midwicket
Trott to Hussey, 1 run Hussey aims a drive, not an expansive one, so helps himself to a single down the ground
Trott to White, 1 run White flings his arms hard at the ball and it trickles down to long-off
Trott to White, no run White finishes the over by pushing to cover
Tremlett to Smith, 1 run full and straight from Tremlett, driven past the bowler for a single
Tremlett to White, 1 run White gets another single by driving towards long on, that asking-rate demands a bit more than singles though
Tremlett to Smith, 1 run Smith moves forward and punches a length ball through cover, the score ticks over
Tremlett to White, no run played off the back foot towards point
Tremlett to White, no run a full toss at 139 kph, it was a touch low, and White pushed it tamely towards the off
Tremlett to White, no run tight line and length. White stride forward and blocks.
Trott to Smith, no run Trott goes past the bat, Smith tried to run it down to third man but couldn't connect
Trott to Smith, no run he should have done better with that full toss, instead Smith sliced it straight to the fielder at point, along the ground though
Trott to Smith, no run whipped off the pads towards midwicket, good timing, no placement
Trott to Smith, FOUR runs short ball and Smith gives that a fearful whack, pulling powerfully over midwicket and wide of the fielder in the deep
Trott to Smith, 2 runs driven off the front foot with power to the deep cover boundary
Trott to Smith, 1 run played off the pads off the front foot through midwicket
Tremlett to Smith, no run Smith drives firmly at a full ball from Tremlett but can't get past the giant of a bowler
Tremlett to Smith, FOUR runs wide outside off stump and Smith throws his bat at the ball, cutting it hard with a flash of his bat, sending it blazing through point
Tremlett to Smith, 1 wide strays down leg side, Tremlett will have to bowl that again
Tremlett to Smith, no run defended on the back foot towards point
Tremlett to Smith, 2 runs Smith opens the face and guides the ball behind point for one, but Smith wants two and he absolutely sprints back for the second. Top running

Tremlett to Smith, 1 leg bye Smith mis-times the pull and gets hit on the body, the ball goes on the off side and there's no run. Prior runs across and throws needlessly at the stumps at the batsman's end and concedes an overthrow of the rebound
Tremlett to White, 2 runs White pulls down to fine leg and smith urges him back for another quick double
Trott to Smith, 1 run full ball outside off, Smith stays in his crease and drills the ball through cover for a single
Trott to White, 2 runs White frees his arms and thumps the ball towards long off, hit with power but just the two
Trott to White, no run played towards the leg side on the front foot
Trott to White, no run hit hard off the back foot towards cover

Trott to White, OUT caught! And that might be it. White decided Trott had to go and muscled a length ball towards long-on. White had to create all the pace because Trott was giving him nothing to work with and he didn't hit it well enough. Yardy ran in from the boundary and held the catch.
Trott to Smith, no run Smith works the ball off the pads towards midwicket
Anderson to Hastings, no run played off the back foot towards point
Anderson to Hastings, 1 run short of a length and the batsman gets on top of the bounce and paddles it towards deep square
Anderson to Smith, no run played with an open face towards point
Anderson to Smith, no run full ball angling into the right-hander, played towards midwicket
Anderson to Smith, 1 run Hastings was out if Strauss had hit the stumps at the batsman's end from midwicket. He didn't

Anderson to Hastings, OUT well Strauss has caught Hastings now! Hastings had moved towards leg to make a bit of room, Anderson followed him with a shorter ball. Hastings was cramped but tried to pull it, the ball hit the top edge and lobbed up towards the leg side. Strauss took a dolly.
Trott to Smith, no run another dot ball, that asking-rate is becoming unmanageable now
Trott to Smith, 1 leg bye moves across his stumps to try and swing it towards fine leg. Can't make contact and gets hit on the pad
Trott to Lee, no run defended from the crease towards the off side
Trott to Lee, no run Lee tries to cut, gets beaten outside off stump
Trott to Lee, no run slow and straight from Trott at 117 kph. Lee plays it back to the bowler. Trott reaches out and fields the ball.
Trott to Lee, 1 run this time he connects with the cut and plays it towards third man
Anderson to Lee, 1 run Lee nudges the ball awkwardly on the leg side and sets off to the non-striker's end
Anderson to Smith, no run Smith pushes the ball towards Anderson's left and the bowler dives full length to make the save
Anderson to Smith, no run Smith also tries to make room to play on the off. Anderson doesn't give it to him and Smith can only push to cover
Anderson to Smith, 2 runs cut off the back foot towards third man
Anderson to Smith, no run played from the crease towards cover, Anderson is bowling wicket to wicket on a tight length
Anderson to Smith, 1 run too straight this time and Smith flicks the ball to the man on the edge of the circle at midwicket
Shahzad to Smith, 2 runs slower ball to start with, Smith flicks it off his pads and tears back for a second and makes it with a full length dive
Shahzad to Smith, no run Smith jumps out of his crease and makes room, Shahzad beats his attempted hit towards the off side and goes between the batsman and the stumps
Shahzad to Smith, 1 run slower ball, played towards short third man and they run a single
Shahzad to Lee, 1 run Lee didn't know too much about that short of a length delivery, it bounced off the high part of the bat and lobbed towards point where it fell short of the fielder
Shahzad to Smith, no run the yorker, beats Smith, and misses leg stump
Shahzad to Smith, 1 run another one in the blockhole, Smith moves towards leg and drives through cover point
Anderson to Smith, 1 run Anderson follows Smith's attempt to make room with a short ball, Smith gets down low and pulls it to deep square leg
Anderson to Lee, no run Lee swishes, aiming for the leg-side boundary, and misses the short ball
Anderson to Lee, FOUR runs up and over. Lee gets under a short and wide ball and cuts it hard over the off side. It bounces once before going over the point boundary
Anderson to Lee, 1 run Lee swings again, aiming for down the ground, but gets an inside edge towards the leg side
Anderson to Smith, 3 runs full ball in the blockhole and Smith manages to squeeze it towards deep backward square leg with a whip of his bat. Morgan dives on the boundary to save the four
Anderson to Lee, (no ball) very short, and extremely wide.
Anderson to Lee, no run and he follows up that wayward delivery with a pinpoint yorker that beats Lee
Shahzad to Smith, 1 run full toss around thigh height, Smith flicks towards the leg side
Shahzad to Lee, 1 run Shahzad follows Lee's movement towards the leg side with a full toss, Lee mis-times his shot over the bowler's head.
Shahzad to Smith, 2 runs short and slow, Smith walks across his stumps and paddles the ball towards deep backward square leg
Shahzad to Smith, no run Smith tries to power the ball through the off side but can't beat cover
Shahzad to Smith, no run the slower ball beats Smith's pull and he sets off for a run. Prior runs towards the stumps and then misses the underarm attempt to hit the stumps
Shahzad to Smith, 1 run full ball outside off, squeezed towards point
Anderson to Smith, 1 leg bye the full ball hits the pad outside off stump after Smith failed to hit the ball through leg after moving across
Anderson to Lee, FOUR runs Lee makes room by moving towards leg, Anderson responds with a delivery in the blockhole just outside off, Lee edges it between the keeper and short third man
Anderson to Lee, 1 run played towards midwicket for a single
Anderson to Smith, 1 run another blockhole delivery, not much Smith can do with that but push it towards the leg side for one
Anderson to Lee, FOUR runs Lee backs away and swings hard at a short ball from Anderson, pulling it flat and fast into the gap between two fielders on the midwicket boundary
Anderson to Lee, 1 run fuller ball this time and Lee hits it down the ground for a single
Shahzad to Lee, 3 runs short, slow ball but it's down leg side, Lee swivels and pulls past short fine leg, he hasn't timed it well enough to get four though
Shahzad to Smith, 4 wide that's wide down leg and Prior fumbles it was well. The ball trickles down towards the boundary and the batsmen run three more
Shahzad to Lee, 2 runs Lee tees off against a full ball and smashes it towards deep midwicket. Won't find the boundary though as two fielders close in on it
Shahzad to Lee, 1 run driven hard along the ground to mid-off
Shahzad to Smith, 1 run Smith makes a lot of room and cuts but he cannot find the angle to place the ball past the fielder at point
Shahzad to Lee, no run up there in the blockhole, Lee can only play it back to Shahzad
Shahzad to Lee, 1 run another terrific death-over delivery, Lee can't get under it and drives towards mid-off
Tremlett to Lee, 1 run short of a length ball and Lee mis-times the slog, the ball falls safely inside the circle near mid-off
Tremlett to Smith, 1 run Smith slogs across the line and gets one towards midwicket
Tremlett to Lee, 2 runs a slow full toss and Lee cuts it towards third man. Wonder how Razzaq would have treated that one
Tremlett to Lee, 1 run Lee flat bats another full ball down the ground towards long on
Tremlett to Smith, no run slower short ball, Smith swings hard and misses. Did I hear a groan as he didn't connect with anything?

Tremlett to Smith, 2 runs full ball and Smith blazes it towards deep cover where Morgan sprints to his right and dives to make the save. He ball slips out of his grasp as he is sliding but he keeps his calm to grab it again. Terrific effort and the throw back to Tremlett is top class. Tremlett broke the stumps and tha
Anderson to Lee, 1 run pulled towards midwicket for one more
Anderson to Smith, FOUR runs full ball angling into middle and leg, Smith swings hard and launches the ball flat towards deep square for a one-bounce four
Anderson to Smith, 1 leg bye full toss on leg stump, Smith should have hammered that but he failed to make proper contact
Anderson to Lee, no run yorker. And a terrific one. Lee gets beaten and the ball blazes between stumps and body
Anderson to Lee, 2 runs Lee swings with all he's got, and he mis-times it. The ball hangs in the air for ages and then falls safely
Anderson to Lee, 1 run driven to long on for one
Tremlett to Lee, 1 bye the slower ball and the batsman fails to make contact. they run a bye and Prior misses the run out again
Tremlett to Smith, FOUR runs Tremlett's yorker gets squeezed out by Smith, steering it past Prior for four
Tremlett to Smith, 1 run another one in the blockhole, driven to cover
Tremlett to Lee, no run full and wide outside off stump, Lee was making room and was then too far away from the ball to play a shot
Tremlett to Lee, FOUR runs Lee makes room, and flays the ball over extra cover. Four runs but it's all futile now
Tremlett to Lee, 1 run pulled away towards deep midwicket and England have kept the series alive with a clinical performance at the Adelaide Oval
The next game is at the Gabba on January 30. Join us then. Cheers!

Australia lead the series 3-1. Today's result has been great for the series. Three dead rubbers would have been too many in a series that already has one match too many. Peter English's bulletin has been updated. It definitely wasn't Australia's Day.
England won by 21 runs
Player of the match is Jonathan Trott, ENG
